item.title: Draw Anything
item.description: The only way Materials A process Demonstration The only way The only way to learn how to draw is to draw, incessantly, passionately, anything. Drawing is as much about careful and heart-felt observation as anything else. There are practices, some rules, but these are learned along the way, a felt-memory as we touch objects with our minds and feelings, here through the tip of a pencil on a piece of paper.

item.title: Welcome!
item.description: Welcome to this site. You will eventually see that I have interests that span many areas including: Philosophy – of knowledge, of objects, of persons – and ethics and ultimately the various manifestations of spirit in the world Mathematical, probabilistic and statistical modeling and computing Art – its practice, influences, history Linguistics – especially indo-european and semitic languages Anything else – as all knowledge is fair game
